page.title: 10 Change in the village
page.content: The village shop closed for trading in about 1974,it used to be housed in Waterloo House at the bottom of the hill.The shop was run for a time after that but was sold as just a house in 1978 .Mrs Lowe was granted a Post Office licence and ran the Post Office from a council bungalow in Rockalls Road,it was later transferred to a converted garage nearby.The shop was lost completely until March 1984 when the Polstead Community Shop was opened in the farm field entrance between the village hall and the old school house,sold in 1982,and now known as"The Master's Lodge".The shop is open on four days a week and stocks a comprehensive selection of groceries useful items,and fresh local produce.A large rota of local volunteers take turns at the shop counter.
